title: Do half-Native American people still look Native Americans? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on what the other half is and the crap shoot that is genetic inheritance. Plus, what people “look like” is highly subjective. I’ve noticed some non-Natives that have a rather rigid notion of this. And if they perceive any non-Native ancestry, then it somehow negates the overall Native “look.” Usually, if the mix is Native-White ancestry, the darker genes are dominant and the person will still be perceived as non-White or “Native-looking” by most people. A smaller minority might inherit more European genes and might fall within the European phenotypic range. Again, this can be rather subjective, anyway. But, if the mix is Native-Black, or Native-Asian then the perception by a wider non-Native population might just see a “Black person” or an “Asian.” This is because America has a distinct issue with Black blood and the One Drop rule. So, if any African ancestry is perceptible, then that person is just seen as “Black.” And the child of a 4/4 blood Native and Asian will likely just be perceived as Asian. This is because the features are already rather close. And many Natives already have slight epicanthic folds, or have them outright. So, these mixed offspring usually take on more pronounced epicanthic folds themselves.

Now full disclosure I have a certain “blank” look and in my travels some people have mistaken me for Middle Eastern, Italian, Filipino, Balkan, Greek, Cambodian, hell even Chinese but I HAVE been told I also look Indigenous. This may not be accurate but my Ancestry DNA test shows that about 50% of my ancestry is Native American/Indigenous Mexican and I’ve been told I look Native American amongst other things. The only issue with that is the people that tell me probably have never seen a full blooded Indigenous man in their lives and are going off the Native Americans they’ve seen in the USA (a lot of whom are mixed). I have a cousin who tested at 60% Native but he looks white to me so it depends.
You tell me. Tantoo Cardinal:  Rickey Medlocke:
